reviews.text: The trains at this station are stuck in time. Literally. It will be 16:15 and the board will still say that your train is expected to arrive at 16:10. The whole northern rail are a joke

Small local rail station with decent links to Warrington, Manchester, Liverpool and beyond. Stairs and lift access is provided as well as a pedestrian bridge. Close to the local birchwood shopping centre; which is just across the road. Waiting room on the main platform has a heater and some seating but the across the bridge its a little smaller.

This station has a waiting room on both platforms but like other reviews it can get a bit cold.  There are some heaters on the wall which can be switched on for you to stand in front of, how often they work I don't know.  The station has recently had some money spent on it and they have built a new bridge which includes a lift for disabled access and parents with push chairs.  This was put in around 2016 I think so its a big help.  Not that many staff around as it only receives about 2-3 trains in one direction per hour.
Nice little and very convenient train 🚂 station.
Come prepared! It gets very cold, and wet, here - primarily as there is no roof on either of the platforms!
